definition: to gamble with life/to take reckless risks
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
variant of 玩[wan2]/Taiwan pr. [wan4]
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: A lot of students in my class like to win, so they read like crazy!
sentences.chinese: 我们班很多同学都想赢得比赛，所以都玩儿命的读书。

sentences.english: He put everything into learning English.

definition: to court disaster/also pr. [zuo1 si3]
erhua variant of 可勁|可劲[ke3 jin4]
vigorously/to the utmost/to the best of one's ability
(coll.) (to beat etc) to death
one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs
all one's strength/with might and main
insane/mad/wild
idiot/fool/foolish
to match one's strength with/to compete/more competitive/to set oneself against sb/disobliging/to make a special effort
erhua variant of 較勁|较劲[jiao4 jin4]
to pester someone again and again
(dialect) to be cocky/smug/to show off
(taboo curse) damn it!/fucking
to throw caution to the wind/to press one's luck/to go for broke
(coll.) to fight to the death
